intro: Tetracarpum pringlei, commonly known as the Pringle's tetracarpum, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and hairy stems. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments at moderate elevations. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both ecological studies and botanical gardens.
